trans-unit.source: A/B Testing
trans-unit.target: A/B Testing

trans-unit.source: **Content Level A/B Testing:** A/B testing on specific documents or resources.
trans-unit.target: **Content Level A/B Testing:** A/B testing on specific documents or resources.

trans-unit.source: **Global Level A/B Testing:** A/B testing on a wide scope, for example theme and page layout which applies to all articles in a given site (or specific locale).
trans-unit.target: **Global Level A/B Testing:** A/B testing on a wide scope, for example theme and page layout which applies to all articles in a given site (or specific locale).

trans-unit.source: Content Level A/B Testing
trans-unit.target: Content Level A/B Testing

trans-unit.source: *Content Level A/B Testing* allows **content owners** to self-service, having variants of contents delivered from the same URL, specifying the split ratio and getting the BI statistics.
trans-unit.target: *Content Level A/B Testing* allows **content owners** to self-service, having variants of contents delivered from the same URL, specifying the split ratio and getting the BI statistics.

trans-unit.source: For example, writers can have **hello.md** and **hello.experimental.md**, and specify that only 10% of the end users would see the experimental version of the document.
trans-unit.target: For example, writers can have **hello.md** and **hello.experimental.md**, and specify that only 10% of the end users would see the experimental version of the document.

trans-unit.source: Design Principles:
trans-unit.target: Design Principles:

trans-unit.source: Keep things **simpler** if possible, avoid over design - especially piling up features that are not actually used.
trans-unit.target: Keep things **simpler** if possible, avoid over design - especially piling up features that are not actually used.

trans-unit.source: All **types of contents** should be able to run A/B testing, including markdown files, plain HTML files, images and audio/video files.
trans-unit.target: All **types of contents** should be able to run A/B testing, including markdown files, plain HTML files, images and audio/video files.

trans-unit.source: The A/B testing **granularity** should be flexible, either covering a single document, or a large group of assets (e.g. images).
trans-unit.target: The A/B testing **granularity** should be flexible, either covering a single document, or a large group of assets (e.g. images).

trans-unit.source: Users should be **affinitized**, which means once a user was routed to version A, he/she should always see version A document unless the browser session info has been explicitly wiped out (e.g. Ctrl + Shift + Delete or InPrivate Session).
trans-unit.target: Users should be **affinitized**, which means once a user was routed to version A, he/she should always see version A document unless the browser session info has been explicitly wiped out (e.g. Ctrl + Shift + Delete or InPrivate Session).

trans-unit.source: Should be **fast**, creating a new test, turning on/off an A/B testing, or updating the split ratio should take effect in **less than 30 seconds**.
trans-unit.target: Should be **fast**, creating a new test, turning on/off an A/B testing, or updating the split ratio should take effect in **less than 30 seconds**.

trans-unit.source: **Corner cases should be covered properly**, A/B testing should work smoothly in a **CDN environment**.
trans-unit.target: **Corner cases should be covered properly**, A/B testing should work smoothly in a **CDN environment**.

trans-unit.source: Also, special logic should be in place to make sure only the default variant *"the A version"* is retrieved by **search crawlers** like Google and Bing.
trans-unit.target: Also, special logic should be in place to make sure only the default variant *"the A version"* is retrieved by **search crawlers** like Google and Bing.

trans-unit.source: Naturally **integrated** into BI and Insights.
trans-unit.target: Naturally **integrated** into BI and Insights.

trans-unit.source: Internal Flow Diagram:
trans-unit.target: Internal Flow Diagram:

trans-unit.source: Global Level A/B Testing
trans-unit.target: Global Level A/B Testing

trans-unit.source: *Global Level A/B Testing* enables two major scenarios:
trans-unit.target: *Global Level A/B Testing* enables two major scenarios:

trans-unit.source: It allows certain feature hypothesis to be practically verified or proved, typically via a collaboration of **the feature stakeholder, feature PM and developers**.
trans-unit.target: It allows certain feature hypothesis to be practically verified or proved, typically via a collaboration of **the feature stakeholder, feature PM and developers**.

trans-unit.source: It allows **engineering team** to roll out a feature smoothly.
trans-unit.target: It allows **engineering team** to roll out a feature smoothly.

trans-unit.source: Design Principles:
trans-unit.target: Design Principles:

trans-unit.source: Keep things **simpler** if possible, a single API `Experiment.IsEnabledAsync` could be used on client (JavaScript) and server (C#) side.
trans-unit.target: Keep things **simpler** if possible, a single API `Experiment.IsEnabledAsync` could be used on client (JavaScript) and server (C#) side.

trans-unit.source: Make it simpler for developers to test and see features on/off side-by-side.
trans-unit.target: Make it simpler for developers to test and see features on/off side-by-side.

trans-unit.source: Users should be **affinitized**, which means once a user saw a feature X turned on, he/she should always see X unless the browser session info has been explicitly wiped out (e.g. Ctrl + Shift + Delete or InPrivate Session).
trans-unit.target: Users should be **affinitized**, which means once a user saw a feature X turned on, he/she should always see X unless the browser session info has been explicitly wiped out (e.g. Ctrl + Shift + Delete or InPrivate Session).

trans-unit.source: Should be **fast**, conducting a new test, turning on/off an A/B testing, or updating the split ratio should take effect in **less than 30 seconds**.
trans-unit.target: Should be **fast**, conducting a new test, turning on/off an A/B testing, or updating the split ratio should take effect in **less than 30 seconds**.

trans-unit.source: Naturally **integrated** into BI and Insights.
trans-unit.target: Naturally **integrated** into BI and Insights.
